1604068022_mirrored_geekless_github.body: @geekless This is absolutely normal behavior of tor! The tor service should be restarted at awake but this you must set on your system instead we need to control tor using the control port. I'm not sure if tor can be restarted using the control port. As I said you need to setup your system to **restart** the tor service after your computer awakes that would solve this issue.

1604068003_mirrored_PMinhDuc_github.body: @PMinhDuc @HelloZeroNet  You should not change the torrc file for Tor Browser! Use **apt install tor** and edit the torrc file there **/etc/tor/torrc**!! In tor browser under **about:config** add the **127.0.0.1:43110** value to your "no proxy on" (with port number).

@MonsterB210 funny at your first screenshot neither HTTPS Everywhere or NoScript can be seen. You should actually remove those plugins. Without script ZeroNet will not work correctly.

topic.title: ZeroNet wrapper freeze
topic.body:
If you rename all ZeroFrame related files and rewrite the source code to something else than "ZeroFrame" your browser will freeze your machine you're running on. 

Sharing files between nodes are working and it is displaying/downloading **correctly** even GitCenter which released by @imachug, however the wrapper can't display @HelloZeroNet, ZeroNet blog etc. Neither /Config works. I checked the source code various times and there is nothing called ZeroFrame and so I can't understand why it is freezing or why it can't display ZeroNet blog just as it is displaying GitCenter. 

Is there any way to get rid of the Wrapper and use only the frame? I think coffeescript is the issue. I would like to remove the entire wrapper.
